question: In a small town, there are 8 clinics serving a population of 23,742. Estimate the number of people each clinic serves by rounding to the nearest thousand.

There are 38,412 students registered this year for the summer camp. There are about __________ fewer students than last year when there were 42,198 students.
(Round off to the nearest hundred)
On average, 2,492 new bank accounts are opened daily. Approximately, _______ new bank accounts are opened in a week if rounded off to the nearest thousand.

In 2017, the highest number of ambulance calls in a month was 8,312. The lowest number of ambulance calls in a month was 731 times. The difference between the highest and lowest use in a month is about ______ calls when rounded to the nearest hundred.
The population of country 1 is 67,721 and of country 2 is 52,103. The approximate population of the two countries is________when rounded off to the nearest tens using the place value method.
